Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.graph

Class TemporalEdge

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.graph.Edge
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.graph.TemporalEdge
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class TemporalEdge extends Edge
A temporal edge is an edge whose parent is the world state before an event occurred and whose child is the world state after the event occurred. The edge's label is the event.

When a temporal edge's label is null, this indicates that a trigger has occurred in some other node which can be reached from this node via epistemic edges. A temporal edge with a null label still leads to a new child state, even though none of the parent node's values will be changed.

Author:
Stephen G. Ware

      public boolean isAuthorAction()

      Returns:
      true if this edge's label is an action with zero consenting characters

    • isDummyAction

      public boolean isDummyAction()
      Tests whether this edge represents a dummy action, which includes the null action and any action whose precondition is false.
      Returns:
      true if this edge's label is null or an event whose precondition is false

    • getBranch

      public TemporalEdge getBranch(Character character)
      When this edge's label is an action, this method returns the temporal edge corresponding to this same action but taken from the state that some given consenting character believed they were in. A branch only exists when (1) this action's label is a non-dummy action and (2) the given character is one of the action's consenting characters or the given character is null, representing the author. When this edge's label is a non-dummy action and the given character is null (representing the author), this method returns this edge itself.

      A branch is useful when reasoning about whether an action is explained. To be explained, an action must be explained for each of its consenting characters. For an action to be explained for a consenting character, that character must believe the action can lead to an increase in its utility. This can be checked by finding the action's branch for that character and testing whether the branch's child state has a higher utility for the character or can lead to a state where utility is higher.

      Parameters:
      character - a character, or null for the author
      Returns:
      returns the corresponding temporal edge in this graph whose Edge.parent is the character's beliefs and whose label is the same action, or null if a branch is not defined for this edge
